description: An unsafe use of strcpy was detected at address 0x00408c64, copying user input data from a stack buffer (sp+0x9d) to another stack buffer (sp+0xdc). Due to the lack of input length validation, this may lead to a buffer overflow vulnerability. Attackers could exploit this vulnerability through carefully crafted HTTP request parameters.
code_snippet:
0x00408c64      f882998f       lw t9, -sym.imp.strcpy(gp)
0x00408c68      dc00a427       addiu a0, sp, 0xdc
0x00408c6c      9d00a527       addiu a1, sp, 0x9d
0x00408c70      09f82003       jalr t9

description: Another strcpy usage was found at address 0x00408e74, copying user input data into a stack buffer. Similarly lacking length checks, posing a buffer overflow risk.

A potential remote command execution vulnerability was identified at address 0x004095d0. By invoking the rdp_action function with the 'ACT_REBOOT' parameter, it may cause the device to reboot. If an attacker gains control over this parameter, it could lead to a denial-of-service attack.
